item.title: Shortcuts
item.description: ctrl + alt + arrow up/down → change desktop ctrl + T → crate new tab ctrl + H → show hidden files ctrl + alt + F1/F2/... → open the tty console. Useful when desktop env. is blocked or for any other reason. One of the function key (typically F7) is used for the graphical session

item.title: Open Source Applications
item.description: This note provides a list of the main open source applications and softwares divided by categories and purposes. Server Web Server: Apache HTTPD (more complete), Nginx (lighter), Stack LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP - for web developers) Database: Postgre, MySQL, MariaDB Unix File Server: NFS Windows File Server: Samba Directory Server: OpenLDAP Desktop Office: LibreOffice, OpenOffice Browser: Firefox, Chromium Email Client: Thunderbird

item.title: Packages
item.description: tree → show the recursive directory structure as a tree view (starting from the current directory)

item.title: VirtualBox
item.description: Create New Virtual Machine Click new and insert name for the OS. It should find the corresponding OS type. If not, select the right type and version; Assign RAM quantity (2GB for 8GB machines should be ok) Create new virtual HD > VDI > Dynamically allocated Select HD size (15GB should be ok) Select the machine and go to Settings General > Advanced tab > select Bidirectional in Shared Clipboard [can copy/paste between VM and base OS]
